response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Element> it = row.getElementsByTag("td").iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
tableEntry.setDate(it.next().text());
tableEntry.setOpen(it.next().text());
tableEntry.setHigh(it.next().text());
tableEntry.setLow(it.next().text());
tableEntry.setClose(it.next().text());
tableEntry.setChangePips(it.next().text());
tableEntry.setChangePercent(it.next().text());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new Iterator for each row of the table in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop. Also, you're using Element.getElementsByTag("td") which returns all td elements in the table, you should use Element.select("td") which returns only the td elements that match the selector "td".
